Package it.polimi.ingsw.GameModel.Characters

Class CharacterManager

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.GameModel.Characters.CharacterManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class CharacterManager extends Object implements Serializable
Class that stores and manages Characters, directing their activation and giving them the Consumer objects which act as their abilities.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterManager

      public CharacterManager(Archipelago archipelago, Bag bag, PlayerList playerList, ProfessorSet professorSet, CoinBag coinbag)
      Constructor for the CharacterManager. Selects three random characters to create.
      Parameters:
      archipelago - the game's archipelago
      bag - the game's student bag
      playerList - the game's player list
      professorSet - the game's professor set

  • Method Details

    • selectRandomCharIDs

      private List<Integer> selectRandomCharIDs()
      Helper function that selects three different numbers from 1 to 12. Used to create three random characters during setup of the game.
      Returns:
      a list containing the three integers

    • createCharacter

      public void createCharacter(int ID, Bag bag)
      Method that initializes a character with the given ID and puts it inside the character list.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the character to create

    • useCharacter

      public List<RequestParameter> useCharacter(Player player, int ID) throws IllegalStateException, IllegalArgumentException
      Precedes a character's ability activation. Calls its delegate useCharacter inside the character with the given ID. The method returns a list of parameters the user needs in order for its ability to activate, which will be picked up by the controller.
      Parameters:
      player - the player who activated this character
      ID - the ID of the character to use
      Returns:
      a list of RequestParameters that will be needed by the game controller
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException
      IllegalArgumentException

    • useAbility

      public void useAbility(List<Integer> parameterList) throws NoSuchElementException, IllegalArgumentException, IllegalStateException, FullTableException, LastRoundException, GameOverException
      Method that executes the character's ability. It passes the list of parameters (in the form of IDs of various pawns/board pieces) and the right Consumer according to the character's ID to the currently active character.
      Parameters:
      parameterList - the list of the consumer's parameters
      Throws:
      NoSuchElementException
      IllegalArgumentException
      IllegalStateException
      FullTableException
      LastRoundException
      GameOverException

    • getCharacterByID

      public AbstractCharacter getCharacterByID(int ID)
      Getter for the Character with the given ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the Character to find
      Returns:
      the Character with the given ID

    • getActiveCharacterID

      public int getActiveCharacterID()
      Getter for the ActiveCharacter ID.
      Returns:
      the ActiveCharacter ID, -1 if no character is active

    • getActiveCharacterMaxUses

      public int getActiveCharacterMaxUses()
      Return the maximum number of times the ability of the active character can be used.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of times the ability of the active character can be used.

    • getActiveCharacterUsesLeft

      public int getActiveCharacterUsesLeft()
      Returns the number of times the ability of the active character can still be used.
      Returns:
      the number of times the ability of the active character can still be used.

    • resetActiveCharacter

      public void resetActiveCharacter()
      Resets the character that was used this round, if there was any

    • getCurrentCharacterIDs

      public List<Integer> getCurrentCharacterIDs()
      Returns:
      a list of IDs of the 3 characters that were randomly chosen for this game

    • getCharacterStudents

      public HashMap<Integer,Color> getCharacterStudents(int ID)
      Getter for the students contained on a given character.
      Parameters:
      ID - the ID of the character to inspect
      Returns:
      a hash map containing the ID of the students as key and their color as value. If no students are contained, the map will be empty

    • getCharacterCost

      public int getCharacterCost(int ID)
      Getter for the current cost of the character.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the cost

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if the given character is overcharged.
